document.title: Indiana Academic Standards for Health & Wellness

402EDA4D93544239BCFC09057C433E10.description: Tell how peers can make positive choices.
comments: Example: Draw a picture to encourage classmates to use a booster seat or wear a safety belt.

43EC8EE005C541E6A6E405A2AA615C08.description: Repeat rules that promote personal health.
comments: Example: Repeat safety rules such as: "don't smell, don't taste, don't touch a poison—ask grown up"; "click it or ticket"; "stop, drop, and roll;" etc.

2499FA0B05C74BF9BF091C85D4FEED9A.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family and community health.

comments: Example: Show safety skills needed to prevent injury (e.g., exit the classroom properly during a fire drill, remain seated while riding a bus, etc.).

6705122623354731B2FD1238CDB4E461.description: Identify healthy behaviors to improve personal health and wellness.
comments: Example: Draw a picture of how family members can help keep their body strong by being physically active instead of using the computer, watching television, or other non-physical activities.

B07A8BAAA0974BF7B2B6293EAC942E17.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce health risks.

13BF6E09616443919459EC831839CFC0.description: Name who can help to achieve a personal health goal.
comments: Example: State who can help when planning to be physically active after the school day (e.g., babysitter, parent, older sibling, relative, etc.).

278E84DF93134823BF3758388CFAE2D4.description: Name personal health and wellness goals.
comments: Example: Name goals such as daily physical activity, getting adequate sleep, eating a balanced diet, and covering the mouth when coughing, etc.

E25360A5FC85449E9947B975E25F5805.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.

CC6E58BCDD964515A7EF700D8DC1E12C.description: Identify when assistance is needed for health-related situations.
comments: Example: Explain that medicine should only be given to children by parents or trusted adults, and/or identify a dangerous situation that requires help (e.g., someone is hurt or being hurt, when you have an ―uh-oh‖ feeling inside, etc.).
Example: List ways to stay safe while traveling to and from school, and/or select an example of an ―always‖ and a ―sometimes‖ after school snack.

686C983A67F74EB3A951EAB9EE625968.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.

0F77E5D7FAB74C5A98FB2ACB3DAAB6B9.description: State ways to tell a trusted adult if feeling threatened.
comments: Example: Show how to tell an adult about a student that is pushing and shoving in the hall, on the playground, or at the bus stop.

23683D2C3EEF4EA1978F73ED222BA8E0.description: State ways to respond when in an unwanted situation.
comments: Example: Name assertive responses or skills that could be used in an unwanted situation at school (e.g., saying No; walking away, etc.).
Example: Brainstorm a list of listening skills appropriate in a variety of classroom and home situations (e.g., when a teacher speaks, during sharing time, when a parent is speaking, etc.).

8C98B2AD739A4CB2939C35B766146C4A.description: Identify healthy ways to express needs.
comments: Example: Indicate appropriate ways to express needs in a variety of situations (e.g., disagreeing with a friend, asking for help with buckling a safety belt, going to the restroom, etc.).

A5EEB9F94EDF4906B68EB627D79C5CBA.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health and avoid or reduce health risks.

ECBBFEDC5EAF40D78CD39A7B70C04BC0.description: Name ways to locate a school helper for a health-related situation.
comments: Example: Describe how to find an adult at school who could help when another student has a bloody nose and/or name the school office as a place to find a school health helper (e.g., principal, school nurse, school counselor, etc.).

425AA9D1F0DA4BDBAF759E744B6B9366.description: Name a person who can help promote health and wellness.
comments: Example: Identify parents, teachers, or doctors as people who can teach others about good health.

258FC3FF45D6416C99CB9D9C130B9099.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to access valid information and products and services to enhance health.

5E866834AB64417D992215443976D33C.description: State how the media influences behaviors.
comments: Example: Name the words (e.g., slogans, rhymes, jingles, etc.) used in commercials to sell a food item, and how they can influence an individual to purchase the product.

1C739C82295E41AF95D672449D82B306.description: Recall what the school can do to support personal health practices.
comments: Example: Recall the school guidelines for communicating feelings to others (e.g., use I messages such as: I feel angry, I am sad, my feelings are hurt, I am happy, etc.), and how the rules were communicated (e.g., posters, verbalized, counselor presentation, role play, etc.).

4891DDEBF3524581B7AE0D887BDC9305.description: Identify how the family influences personal health practices.
comments: Example: Name the health practices of family members observed (e.g., brushing teeth, washing hands, wearing safety belt, looking both ways before crossing a street, etc.), and/or name physical activities in which you have observed family members participating (e.g., mowing the yard, working in the garden, running on treadmill, bicycling, playing kickball, etc.).

E8F978633E724E738F75C39B6F99E3E8.description: Students will analyze the influence of family, peers, culture, media, technology and other factors on health behaviors.

74080D4EED214695AC157743F46940F6.description: Tell why it is important to be checked by a doctor or dentist.
comments: Example: State the benefits of going to the doctor and/or dentist.
Example: Tell peers how to play safely on the playground to prevent injuries.
EF642A626EB844499FF3E463ADFDA49E.description: State behaviors to prevent or reduce childhood injuries.

2054D7B2B6CE41B09E8AB062D47FAC67.description: Tell ways to prevent the spread of germs.
comments: Example: Tell about self-care routines that can help prevent illness and infectious diseases.

AB340E08B8FA4D95922593B5913C40A8.description: Identify that physical health is one dimension of health and wellness.
comments: Example: Identify that a healthy person exercises, eats well, and goes to the doctor.
Example: State that brushing teeth, eating breakfast, not using tobacco, and getting adequate sleep are examples of healthy behaviors.

619A53FB4CA44B4B91591853B8DC5CE9.description: Students will comprehend concepts related to health promotion and disease prevention to enhance health.
comments: Students acknowledge personal responsibility for health promotion and/or risk reduction. They describe healthy behaviors to prevent or reduce their risk of injury and/or illness. Students list the components of health as emotional, physical and social.
